content.webTitle: Sailing: Dunstone breezes home in tricky wind conditions

fields.headline: Dunstone breezes home in tricky wind conditions
fields.bodyText: Clever sailors enjoy the challenge of a fickle wind. Charles Dunstone and the crew of Cockburn's Red are among them and yesterday their TP-52 scored a resounding victory in Class 1 to win the New York Yacht Club Cup at Cowes Week. Racing started late due to the relative failure of the sea breeze to materialise. There was eventually enough to start, but it did not maintain its early promise and made progress extremely tricky. The Volvo Ocean Race director, Glenn Bourke, gained his third consecutive win in the 98-boat Laser SB-3 fleet. Bourke put his success down to: "Patience, it was a hard day and there were holes in the wind."
